Description: Fragment of a mould-made pottery plastic lamp in the form of a slave mask wearing a floral fillet, tied at the side with a ribbon. The mask has a wide trumpet-like mouth and prominent brows. There is a plain slightly raised edge above and on the right side; the rest is broken away. Covered with a red slip; details are picked out in pink and dark red pigment, presumably fired on.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q577.bis)
Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (C647)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
